==== Issues Relating To Scanning ====

Scanning allows users to reduce desktop clutter and manage everything digitally.  What can we do to make scanning work better?

* Scanner button support:  in a small office of six people one scanner is connected to a Ubuntu desktop, a user insert a paper to scan and presses one button to scan to a shared folder, another button to scan to a shared email account.  Can this be implemented without having to login and use the XSane Imager Scanner tool?  In another office a scanner is connected to one of the users machines, the other members of the office don't want to keep annoying the desktop user so they open up XSane Image Scanner tool and select the scanner on the network, they walk up to the scanner insert a paper to scan and press a button which sends the image back to the users desktop, the user removes the paper and returns to their desktop to save the scanned image.
*** It's a cool proposal. I can see that Mr. McCoy has a grip on how technology should be. I don't know if the current technology would allow us to do it. Ubuntu is worked on by people who are part of GNOME, etc, but I don't know how much sway they have. Or if these kinds of tools could even be developed between now and Feisty. But if they can, they'll have my support.
**** We (Gnome & Freedesktop) are working on a dbus service (basically handle device list, access, monitor buttons, share) for scanning + UI (a GtkPrint-like API). -- Ã‰tienneBersac 
* XSane is too difficult: The current default scanning program (xsane) included in Ubuntu is too difficult to use. Some usability issues are as follows:
*** By default it opens as four separate windows.
*** The "Scan" button and "Aquire Preview" button are on two separate windows
*** The default color mode is "binary." It should be color.
*** There are too many options/controls by default.
*** The functionality of the options/controls are not obvious.
 Some suggestions to improve the usabilty of scanning in Feisty Fawn while keeping advanced features available (Either a new program be developed or xsane be modified to do the following):
*** By default open as a single window.
*** The "Aquire Preview" button renamed to "Preview".
*** Have separate modes of operation. For example, "simple" and "advanced". Simple is the default mode that has only the most basic of options available on the UI. Advanced gives all the options available.
*** Help menu options, etc should open up in the default gnome help system and not in  Mozilla. (behaves more Gnome-like)  --BrettBurton

 I think <nowiki>[[http://live.gnome.org/GnomeScan?action=show&redirect=GnomeScanning|GnomeScan]]</nowiki> from a Google SoC project will help here, should ship with Gnome 2.18 which is up for Feisty. --StevenMcCoy
